source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_032_chunk1
evidence_span: six intermetallics (Zr₂Fe, Zr₃Fe₄Cr₂, Zr₁₀Fe₃Ni₂, Zr₄Sn, ZrCr₂, and 3Zr₂Ni) were prepared for corrosion and electrochemical tests
alloy_name: Zr₂Fe, Zr₃Fe₄Cr₂, Zr₁₀Fe₃Ni₂, Zr₄Sn, ZrCr₂, 3Zr₂Ni, Zircaloy-2, Zircaloy-4, crystal-bar zirconium
process_step: prepared for corrosion and electrochemical tests
test_type: corrosion tests, electrochemical tests, SEM/EDX examinations, potential measurements, autoclave tests
conditions: ambient and elevated temperatures, water and steam

extra_properties.corrosion_resistance_mechanisms: electrochemical effects, oxide ductility, electronic and ionic conductivities, induced stresses, oxide structure transformation
extra_properties.testing_locations: Teledyne Wah Chang Albany and Siemens AG-KWU Group

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_032_chunk2
evidence_span: After more than 30 years of investigations to understand the corrosion behavior of zirconium alloys
corrosion_formula: empirically fitted correlations of weight gain (oxide thickness)
